Silicate Technology.description: Mass ratio used to express the proportion of one oxide to another in a glass batch (e.g. SiO2 : Na2O).

Silicate Technology.name: Mole Fraction of Component i
Silicate Technology.description: Mole fraction of oxide i in a glass or ceramic batch.

Silicate Technology.name: Viscosity-Temperature Relationship (Arrhenius Type)
Silicate Technology.description: Simple Arrhenius-type expression for viscosity of silicate melts.

Silicate Technology.name: Gas Volume Released During Fusion
Silicate Technology.description: Ideal gas law to estimate CO_{2} or SO_{2} volume released from batch decomposition.

Silicate Technology.description: Sensible plus latent heat needed to bring a batch to its melting point and fuse it.

Silicate Technology.name: Batch Composition Ratio
Silicate Technology.formula: R = \frac{\text{Mass of oxide A}}{\text{Mass of oxide B}}
Silicate Technology.description: Mass ratio used to express the proportion of one oxide to another in a glass batch (e.g. SiO_{2} : Na_{2}O).

Silicate Technology.name: Mole Fraction of Component i
Silicate Technology.description: Mole fraction of oxide i in a glass or ceramic batch.

Silicate Technology.name: Viscosity–Temperature Relationship (Arrhenius Type)
Silicate Technology.description: Simple Arrhenius-type expression for viscosity of silicate melts.

Silicate Technology.name: Gas Volume Released During Fusion
Silicate Technology.description: Ideal gas law to estimate CO_{2} or SO_{2} volume released from batch decomposition.

Silicate Technology.name: Heat Required for Melting
Silicate Technology.formula: Q = m c_{p} (T_{\text{m}} - T_{\text{0}}) + m L_{\text{f}}
Silicate Technology.description: Sensible plus latent heat needed to bring a batch to its melting point and fuse it.

Silicate Technology.name: Mass Balance for Batch Melting
Silicate Technology.description: Mass balance relating raw batch input to produced glass and evolved gases during melting.

variables.\\sum m_{\\text{raw}}: Total mass of raw materials fed (kg)

Silicate Technology.name: Energy Requirement for Melting
Silicate Technology.formula: Q = \sum_{i} m_{i} c_{p,i} (T_{\text{m}} - T_{0}) + \sum_{i} m_{i} L_{\text{f},i}
Silicate Technology.description: Total energy needed to heat each batch component from its initial temperature to the melting temperature and to fuse it.

variables.c_{p,i}: Specific heat capacity of component i (J·kg^{-1}·K^{-1})
variables.L_{\\text{f},i}: Latent heat of fusion for component i (J·kg^{-1})

Silicate Technology.name: Heat Loss Through Furnace Walls
Silicate Technology.description: Estimation of heat loss from a glass melting furnace by conduction through its walls.

variables.A: Surface area of the furnace walls (m^{2})
variables.\\Delta T: Temperature difference between inside and outside (K)

Silicate Technology.name: CO_{2} Released From Carbonates
Silicate Technology.description: Moles of CO_{2} released when carbonates decompose during melting.

variables.\\nu_{\\text{CO}_{2}}: Stoichiometric coefficient of CO_{2} in the decomposition reaction (mol CO_{2}/mol carbonate)

Silicate Technology.name: Residence Time of Melt in Furnace
Silicate Technology.description: Average residence time of molten glass in the melting furnace.

variables.V_{\\text{melt}}: Volume of molten glass in the furnace (m^{3})
variables.Q_{\\text{throughput}}: Volumetric flow rate of molten glass leaving (m^{3}·s^{-1})

Silicate Technology.name: Refining Bubble Rise Velocity (Stokes' Law Approximation)
Silicate Technology.description: Estimated rise velocity of gas bubbles in viscous silicate melts during refining.

Silicate Technology.name: Annealing Time
Silicate Technology.description: Estimated time required to anneal a glass piece based on its half-thickness and a constant dependent on glass composition.

Silicate Technology.name: Annealing Stress Relaxation
Silicate Technology.description: Residual stress in glass decreases exponentially with time during annealing.

Silicate Technology.name: Thermal Stress Due to Temperature Gradient
Silicate Technology.description: Stress generated by temperature difference between surface and core during heating or cooling.

Silicate Technology.name: Critical Cooling Rate for Tempering
Silicate Technology.description: Minimum cooling rate needed to develop temper stresses from glass transition temperature to ambient.

Silicate Technology.name: Surface Compressive Stress in Tempered Glass
Silicate Technology.description: Approximate compressive stress generated at the surface of tempered glass after quenching.

Silicate Technology.name: Fracture Strength of Tempered Glass
Silicate Technology.description: Approximate increase in fracture strength of tempered glass by adding induced compressive stress to intrinsic strength.

Silicate Technology.name: Bulk Density of Ceramic Body
Silicate Technology.description: Bulk density of a dried or fired ceramic body including its pores.

variables.V_{\\text{total}}: Total external volume of the sample (m^{3})

Silicate Technology.name: Porosity of Ceramic Body
Silicate Technology.description: Fractional porosity of a ceramic body from its bulk and skeletal densities.

variables.\\rho_{s}: Skeletal (true) density of the solid phase (kg·m^{-3})

Silicate Technology.name: Shrinkage on Firing
Silicate Technology.description: Linear shrinkage of a ceramic specimen during firing.

Silicate Technology.name: Water Absorption
Silicate Technology.description: Percentage of water absorbed by a ceramic sample after immersion.

Silicate Technology.name: Sintering Rate
Silicate Technology.description: Rate equation for densification of a ceramic body during sintering.

Silicate Technology.name: Thermal Shock Resistance
Silicate Technology.description: Resistance of a ceramic to thermal shock depends on its strength, elasticity, and expansion.

Silicate Technology.name: Thermal Conductivity from Porosity
Silicate Technology.description: Approximate effective thermal conductivity of a porous ceramic body.

variables.k_{s}: Thermal conductivity of the solid phase (W·m^{-1}·K^{-1})

Silicate Technology.name: Refractoriness Under Load (RUL) Stress
Silicate Technology.description: Stress applied to a refractory specimen during refractoriness-under-load testing.

Silicate Technology.name: Creep Rate of Refractory
Silicate Technology.description: High-temperature creep rate of a refractory material following an Arrhenius-type dependence.

Silicate Technology.name: Apparent Porosity of Refractory
Silicate Technology.description: Apparent porosity of a refractory calculated using dry, saturated, and immersed weights.

variables.W_{i}: Weight of sample immersed in water (kg)

Silicate Technology.name: Cold Crushing Strength
Silicate Technology.description: Cold crushing strength of a refractory sample — load at failure divided by cross-sectional area.

Silicate Technology.name: Thermal Conductivity of Composite
Silicate Technology.description: Rule-of-mixtures estimate for thermal conductivity of a two-phase glass/ceramic composite.

Silicate Technology.name: Elastic Modulus of Composite
Silicate Technology.description: Rule-of-mixtures estimate for elastic modulus of a glass or ceramic composite.

Silicate Technology.name: Thermal Expansion of Composite
Silicate Technology.description: Approximate linear coefficient of thermal expansion of a composite material.

Silicate Technology.name: Water–Cement Ratio
Silicate Technology.description: Mass ratio of water to cement, a key parameter affecting strength and setting time.

Silicate Technology.name: Setting Time by Vicat Test
Silicate Technology.description: Difference between final and initial setting time of cement paste as measured by Vicat apparatus.

Silicate Technology.name: Compressive Strength of Mortar/Cement Cube
Silicate Technology.description: Compressive strength obtained by dividing maximum load at failure by cross-sectional area of specimen.

Silicate Technology.name: Heat of Hydration
Silicate Technology.description: Total heat evolved during hydration of cement.

Silicate Technology.name: Degree of Hydration
Silicate Technology.description: Fraction of hydration achieved at time t compared to total possible heat of hydration.

variables.Q_{t}: Cumulative heat released at time t (J)
variables.Q_{\\infty}: Total heat of hydration for complete reaction (J)

Silicate Technology.name: Air Content in Fresh Concrete (Pressure Method)
Silicate Technology.description: Percentage of air entrained in fresh concrete measured by pressure drop.

Silicate Technology.name: Workability (Slump Test)
Silicate Technology.description: Slump measured as the difference between original cone height and the height after removal.

variables.h_{\\text{slump}}: Height of concrete after cone removed (m)

Silicate Technology.name: Chemical Durability Index
Silicate Technology.description: Rate of mass loss per unit surface area per time, used to express chemical durability of glass or ceramic.

Silicate Technology.name: Leach Rate
Silicate Technology.description: Leaching rate of a particular ion from glass or ceramic into solution.

variables.C_{i}: Mass concentration of ion in solution (kg·m^{-3})

Silicate Technology.name: Alkali Resistance
Silicate Technology.description: Fraction of mass retained after alkali exposure, used as an index of resistance.

Silicate Technology.name: Permeability of Porous Ceramic
Silicate Technology.description: Darcy’s law used to determine gas or liquid permeability of a porous silicate specimen.

Silicate Technology.name: Diffusion Coefficient of Ion in Glass
Silicate Technology.description: Temperature dependence of diffusion coefficient of an ion in glass or silicate.

Silicate Technology.name: Stress Corrosion (Subcritical Crack Growth)
Silicate Technology.description: Rate of subcritical crack growth in glass under stress corrosion conditions.

Silicate Technology.name: Fracture Toughness
Silicate Technology.description: Critical stress intensity factor at fracture for a flaw of size a.

Silicate Technology.name: Specific Corrosion Rate
Silicate Technology.description: Mass loss rate per unit area during chemical attack.

Silicate Technology.name: Thermal Cycling Fatigue Damage Parameter
Silicate Technology.description: Damage parameter after N thermal cycles of temperature swing ΔT.

Silicate Technology.name: Glass Transition Temperature Criterion (Fox Equation)
Silicate Technology.description: Predicts the glass transition temperature of a binary mixture.

Silicate Technology.name: Vogel–Fulcher–Tammann (VFT) Equation
Silicate Technology.description: Temperature dependence of viscosity near glass transition.

Silicate Technology.name: Williams–Landel–Ferry (WLF) Equation
Silicate Technology.description: Shift factor for time-temperature superposition in glassy polymers or silicates.

Silicate Technology.name: Nucleation Rate
Silicate Technology.description: Steady-state nucleation rate for crystal formation in glass.

variables.\\Delta G^{*}: Critical free energy barrier for nucleation (J)

Silicate Technology.name: Critical Radius for Nucleus
Silicate Technology.description: Radius of a critical nucleus during crystallisation.

variables.\\Delta G_{v}: Free energy change per unit volume (J·m^{-3})

Silicate Technology.name: Avrami Equation (Isothermal Crystallization Kinetics)
Silicate Technology.description: Fraction crystallized as a function of time at constant temperature.

variables.n: Avrami exponent indicating nucleation and growth mechanism

Silicate Technology.name: Transformation Rate
Silicate Technology.description: Rate of crystallization from the Avrami equation.

Silicate Technology.name: Time-Temperature-Transformation (TTT) Critical Cooling Rate
Silicate Technology.description: Approximate critical cooling rate to avoid crystallisation.

variables.t_{x}: Time at nose of TTT curve (s)

Silicate Technology.name: Activation Energy for Viscous Flow (Arrhenius Form)
Silicate Technology.description: For some silicate melts, viscosity can be Arrhenius rather than VFT.

Silicate Technology.name: Refractive Index (n)
Silicate Technology.description: Refractive index in terms of relative permittivity and permeability; for non-magnetic silicates μ_r≈1 so n≈√ε_r.

Silicate Technology.name: Snell's Law
Silicate Technology.description: Refraction of light at interface between two media with refractive indices n1 and n2.

Silicate Technology.name: Beer–Lambert Law (Absorption)
Silicate Technology.description: Exponential attenuation of light intensity through an absorbing medium; α is the absorption coefficient.

Silicate Technology.name: Optical Transmittance (Thickness)
Silicate Technology.description: Fraction of light transmitted through a slab of thickness d with absorption coefficient α.

Silicate Technology.name: Rayleigh Scattering Intensity (qualitative)
Silicate Technology.description: Wavelength dependence of scattering by particles much smaller than wavelength (qualitative relation).

Silicate Technology.name: Optical Band Gap from Tauc Plot (Indirect)
Silicate Technology.description: Tauc relation used to estimate optical band gap Eg from absorption data for indirect transitions.

variables.E_{g}: Optical band gap energy (J or eV)

Silicate Technology.name: Dielectric Constant (Capacitor Parallel-Plate)
Silicate Technology.description: Capacitance of a parallel plate capacitor filled with a dielectric material.

Silicate Technology.name: Conductivity (Ohmic)
Silicate Technology.description: Electrical conductivity as inverse resistivity; relation to measured resistance R of a sample.

Silicate Technology.name: Arrhenius Temperature Dependence of Conductivity
Silicate Technology.description: Thermally activated conduction (ionic) in glasses/ceramics; k_B is Boltzmann constant.

Silicate Technology.name: Dielectric Loss Tangent (tan δ)
Silicate Technology.description: Ratio of imaginary to real parts of complex permittivity describing dielectric losses.

Silicate Technology.name: Complex Refractive Index
Silicate Technology.description: Real part n gives refraction, imaginary part κ (extinction coefficient) gives absorption.
